questions.text: Photosynthesis occurs in the chloroplast of plant cells.
Stomata are present only on the upper surface of leaves.
Phloem transports water and minerals in plants.
Insulin is produced by the pancreas.
DNA is the genetic material found in the nucleus of cells.
Red blood cells have a nucleus.
Neuron is the smallest cell in the human body.
Hormones are chemical messengers in our body.
Mitochondria is called the powerhouse of the cell.
